description.narrative: Strengthening the current functional and technical capacities of MACs to effectively coordinate and harmonize delivery of Government of Liberia and UNDP programme.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Output 1: Indicator 1.1: Rate of financial reporting requirement compliance. Indicator 1.2: # of Finance staff enrolled for accounting certification with 25% women representation Indicator 1.3: # of MACs Procurement staff undertake hands-on training and CIPS Level 2 certification with 25% women representation Indicator 1.4: Online M&E national database portal # of M&E plans # of M&E reports uploaded on database # of sector projects Indicator: 1.5: # of M&E manuals printed and distributed Indicator 1.6: Curriculum on short-term National Implementation (NIM) training developed
Output 2: Indicator 2.1: % of projects completed aligned to AfT Indicator 2.2: # of Private sector constituency engagement meetings # of civil society constituency engagement meetings Indicator 2.3: National NGO Policy Indicator 2:4: Revised NGO database and with up-to date information Indicator 2.5: # of training on Donor engagement & Mgt conducted with at least 20% women
Output 4: Indicator 4.1: # of staff with technical skills in respective functional area Indictor4.2: # of LRA Medium Term (3-5 years) IT Strategy developed and being adhere to # of servers for Data Center being constructed at LRA HQ # of industrial copiers to effectuate enhanced IT service delivery # of vehicle to facilitate mobility of IT team between HQ, sector ministries and Tax and Customs Business Offices
Output 5: Indicator 5.1: # Social-economic report Indicator 5.2: # Economic Journals published
Output 6: Indicators 6: # of “special media platforms supported # of communication and knowledge products produced and disseminated # of Media stories # of quarterly progress reports Annual report

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Baseline: (2014) Gaps identified in micro-assessment for program implementation, financial reporting and procurement capacities of 40 MAC
Baseline: (2014) 36 MACs Finance Staff started training on ATSWA/CPA at LIPA coordinated by LICPA
Baseline: (2014) Gaps identified in micro-assessment for procurement certification capacities of 40 MACs.
Baseline:(2013) MACs M&E capacity limited and 32 MACs M&E assessed. No organized means of reporting
Baseline:(2013) Draft M&E and capacity building plans developed
Baseline:(2014) NIM Toolkit produced and NIM trainings workshops held, for sustainability, NIM training needs to be institutionalized through LIPA
Output 2: Baseline: (2014) 50 percent
Baseline: (2013)1 private sector engagement meeting held
Baseline: (2011) Draft NGO policy in place
Baseline: (1998) NGO database created
Baseline: (2013/2014) 2 Trainings already conducted
Output 4: Baseline: (2014) New functional areas for hired Directors and Assistant Directors under the newly created LRA and MFDP
Baseline: (2014) No IT strategy in place; Data center under construction by UNDP; It team currently has one vehicle
Output 5: Baseline: (2014) Social-economic data is available but needs to be updated
Baseline: (2014) Economic papers are written but no regular economic journals produced
Output 6:
Baselines: 1. Limited publicity of UNDP’s contribution to development (source: ADR report) 2. Draft partnership and communication strategy in place

Output 1.2.1 Develop Public Information Materials for CFM and Covid-19 Awareness Output 1.2.2 Assess CFM Facilities in Bomi, Nimba and Grand Gedeh Counties Output 1.2.3 Maintain Solar Panel Equipment in Sinoe and Grand Bassa Counties Output 1.2.4 Conduct the National Launch of the CFM Platform Output 1.2.5 Conduct Target Seetting Workshop for Cabinet MACs

Output 1.2.1 Public Information Materials were developed and aired on community radios across the country to reduce the vulnerability of the population from Covid-19 infections Output !.2.2 An assessment and monitoring visits were conducted for Bomi, Nimba and Grand Bassa Counties. The monitoring could not reached Grand Gedeh County due to bad road. The assessment focused on the Solar Needs for each of the facilities. Output 1.2.3 The recruitment process started to maintain the solar panel in Grand Bassa. A vendor was identified through competitive process awaiting awarding contract to the winner of the bid. Output 1.2.4 The procurement was concluded for the IEC materials for the launch but the date of the launch keep adjustment due to the availability of the President to do the launch. Output 1.2.5 The Target Setting Workshop was conducted for the 25 Cabinet MACs which is now leading to way for the production of the Performance Contract between the head of the Cabinet MACS and the President.

Output 1 12 Desk tops, 4 LCD Projectors for training rooms, and accessories 15 Staff trained in CGAP Output 2 Printing of PAPD M&E Framework PAPD Citizen Guide Output 3 75 trained in CIPS Level 3 30 Trained in CIPS Level 4 Output 4 Aid Management SOP Manual MFDP Strategic Plan 2019-2024 Tax Payer Compliance Recognition One Regional DRM Forum Output 5 HIES Thematic Analysis Report Research and Forecasting Training Center for UL Output 6 Performance Contract between President and Ministers Citizen feedback Mechanism Established Capacity of Cabinet Secretariat Strengthened Output 7 2019 Quarterly Technical/Steering Committee meeting Quarterly Progress Report Annual Progress Report

Output 1 12 desktop Computers, 4 LCD Projectors, Server for e-learning was procured and are installed in the Buchanan facility of LIPA Total of 46 Auditors (8F/38M) benefited from CGAP training
Output 2 600 copies of the PAPD were printed and distributed Draft M&E framework developed Citizen Guide to the PAPD was developed and more than 3,000 copies were printed and disseminated
Output 3 69 participants benefited from CIPS Level 3 training and are currently doing their projects 75 participants benefited from CIPS Level 4 Training and are currently doing their projects Output 4 Aid Management SOP was developed awaiting cabinet approval. MFDP Strategic Plan was developed, validated and printing is ongoing. Tax Payer appreciation and recognition was conducted which was preceded by the tax payer awareness campaign. A regional Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) forum was held which paved the way for the implementation of the DRM strategy
Output 5 HIES survey report was analyzed and validated. The final report be concluded with validation inputs. Sets of computers and accessories were procured and turn over the Research Lab at University of Liberia. This will enhance research capacity of users for forecasting and econometric analysis.
Output 6 Draft performance Contract was developed. The President of Liberia issued the Cabinet Directory mandating all government ministries, agencies and commissions to adopt performance management and compliance system and citizen feedback mechanism as a mean in improving institutional efficiency and effectiveness. The Prototype of Citizen Feedback Mechanism (CFM) was developed and approved by the cabinet. A server hosting company was hired, and system is already developed ready for deployment. Series of capacity building training was conducted to enhance the capacity of Cabinet staff to effectively enhance the operations of the secretariat.
Output 7 Two technical/Steering Committee meeting was coordinated which result assisted in the delivery of the project activities. 1st and 2nd quarter progress report was prepared, signed and distributed. One SET project board meeting was coordinated and report prepared.
Output 1.2.5. Develop Performance Contract for 10 of the 25 Cabinet MACs. this activity was transferred from C4DE to the CFM under Decentralization Programme
this activity was transferred from C4DE to the CFM under Decentralization Programme
No longer applicable, project should be close both financially and operationally.
